attributes.title: Jabulani
attributes.description: This annotated map shows where the materials of the 2010 FIFA World Cup ball "Jabulani", come from as well as the process of the creation of the ball such as designing, manufacturing, etcetera.
The designing of the ball and the concept of the ball was done in the Adidas Headquarters in Herzogenaurach, Germany
attributes.title: Adidas Headquarters

attributes.description: NASA scientists concluded that the Jabulani, with its relatively smoother surface, the ball started to travel at a higher speed of 45–50 mph (72–80 km/h).
attributes.title: Adidas Official Laboratory

attributes.description:
used as the inner carcass of the ball. The inner carcass provides structure, shape and protection for the inner layers of the ball. 
manufactured in China
attributes.title: Cotton Fabric

attributes.description:
Fortunately Adidas released videos on various online video sites such as youtube, showing the process of making the ball in factories in China.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=zbLjk4OTRdI
attributes.title: Manufacture Factory

attributes.description:
Used as the inner carcass of the ball. The inner carcass provides structure, shape and protection for the inner layers of the ball. 
manufactured in China
attributes.title: Isotropic polyester

attributes.description:
The Jabulani ball has three dimensional panels. These then are spherically molded from Ethylene vinyl acetate. Ethylene vinyl acetate are Flexible, similar to rubber except it is translucent. It is known for its strength and resistance to tearing. 
Manufactured in China
attributes.title: Ethylene vinyl acetate
Ink
attributes.description:
Eleven different colors are used in the ball, and these eleven colors represent the eleven players in every team. The Ink is used for all of the colors of the ball and so, a large amount of Ink must be used. 
The Ink is manufactured in China.

attributes.title: Glue
attributes.description:
In order to attach the 3D tripod panel with the inner carcass (polyester and cotton fabric) the factories use glue by hand instead of mechanical solutions.
Glueing the panels together is cheaper than stitching. Manufactured in Japan

attributes.title: Butyl
attributes.description:
Used for the bladder of the ball. The first layer of the ball that maintains the air pressure for proper inflation. Butyl bladders retain air for longer periods of time compared to latex.
Manufactured in India

attributes.title: Thermoplastic Polyurethane Elastomer
attributes.description:
Used for the Windings of the ball. They add structural integrity and durability to the construction of the ball.
Manufactured in Taiwan

attributes.title: Shanghai Giti Ball Factory
attributes.description: Established in 2003, Giti Ball Factory specializes in the production and distribution of all kinds of promotional items and toys.

attributes.title: Manufacture Factory
attributes.description: One of the factories where the FIFA 2010 world cup ball s were manufactured. The materials for the Jabulani are transported to this factory, and then the ball is created by both machines and hand (humans).

attributes.title: Designing and Creating Assistant
attributes.description: Loughborough University helped Adidas within the creation and the designing of the ball, as they were research partners.

attributes.title: Markets
attributes.description: After the manufacturing of the balls are complete, they are shipped to markets all over the world, as the ball is sold in many different destinations for $149.99 (may vary depending on country)

attributes.title: Thermoplastic Polyurethane Elastomer to Manufacture Factory

Thermoplastic Polyurethane Elastomer to Shanghai Giti Ball Factory
